41.long: (denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

41.brief: from out, out from among, from
41.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.
(lit: well-named, to avoid the evil omen attaching to the left), on the left-hand side, left.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.
(adj. used often as a noun), slanderous; with the article: the Slanderer (par excellence), the Devil.
a messenger, generally a (supernatural) messenger from God, an angel, conveying news or behests from God to men.

41.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
41.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

42.long: I am hungry, needy, desire earnestly.
I offer, give; I put, place.
I eat, partake of food; met: I devour, consume (e.g. as rust does); used only in fut. and 2nd aor. tenses.

42.brief: I cause to drink, give to drink
42.long: I cause to drink, give to drink; irrigate, water.

43.long: alien, new, novel; noun: a guest, stranger, foreigner.
I gather together, collect, assemble, receive with hospitality, entertain.
rarely: stark-naked; generally: wearing only the under-garment; bare, open, manifest; mere.
I cast around, wrap a garment about, put on; hence mid: I put on to myself, clothe myself, dress; I draw (a line).
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick.
a watching, keeping guard; a guard, prison; imprisonment.

43.brief: I look upon, visit, look out, select
43.long: I look upon, visit, look out, select.

44.long: I answer, reply, take up the conversation.

44.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
44.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

I see, look upon, experience, perceive, discern, beware.
I am hungry, needy, desire earnestly.
alien, new, novel; noun: a guest, stranger, foreigner.
rarely: stark-naked; generally: wearing only the under-garment; bare, open, manifest; mere.
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick.

I wait at table (particularly of a slave who waits on guests); I serve (generally).

45.long: I answer, reply, take up the conversation.

45.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
45.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

45.brief: verily, truly, amen, so let it be
45.long: verily, truly, amen; at the end of sentences may be paraphrased by: So let it be.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

45.brief: on, to, against, on the basis of, at
45.long: on, to, against, on the basis of, at.

45.brief: how much, how great, how many
45.long: how much, how great, how many, as great as, as much.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.
least, smallest, but perhaps oftener in the weaker sense: very little, very small.
neither, nor, not even, and not.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.

46.brief: I come or go away from, depart, return
46.long: I come or go away from, depart, return, arrive, go after, follow.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
chastisement, punishment, torment, perhaps with the idea of deprivation.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

46.brief: but, on the other hand, and
46.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
just; especially, just in the eyes of God; righteous; the elect (a Jewish idea).
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.
life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.
